summary: In this context, sulfur dioxide (SO2) and ozone (O3) are both identified as major air pollutants that can negatively impact athletes and exercisers. The review highlights the harmful effects of ozone, particularly on hot days, while sulfur dioxide is mentioned alongside other pollutants. However, the specific relationship between SO2 and O3 is not elaborated upon, indicating they are part of a broader discussion on air quality and health effects during exercise.
